head: cos(A)
tail: Given angle is not a special angle, use special angles (i.e., 30, 45, 60, or 90) to decompose it.

head: sin(A)
tail: Given angle is not a special angle, use special angles (i.e., 30, 45, 60, or 90) to decompose it.

head: tan(A)
tail: Given angle is not a special angle, use special angles (i.e., 30, 45, 60, or 90) to decompose it.

head: asin(A) + bcos(A)
tail: maximum value of asinA + bcosA is \sqrt(a^2+b^2), minimum value of y is -sqrt(a^2+b^2)

head: Triangle
tail: all sides are equal, all angles are equal to 60 degree

head: ABC
tail: Area of ABC = 1/2*ab*sinC where a and b can be any two sides and C is the included angle

head: arithmetic sequence
tail: For the number X, Y, Z which form an arithmetic sequence, then Y - X = Z - Y and 2Y = X + Z

head: geometric sequence
tail: For the number X, Y, Z which form an geometric sequence, then Y/X = Z/Y and Y^2 = X*Z
